title: A Fine Payoff for Reading the Ingredients
sub_head: Companies are being hit with class-action lawsuits by people who claim not to have read the packaging
body:
They say you should always read the fine print. Sometimes reading it only after you have parted with your money can work out nicely too. A rash of lawsuits has been aimed at consumer goods companies for misleading customers using nearly identical language.
Take Mandell Mitchell, who alleged in an October filing against Whole Foods that its Organic 365 ice cream bars claim to have a “chocolate coating” when that coating also contains vegetable oil.
